name: Baby Tears
climate: Baby Tears thrive in mild and humid environments typical of tropical regions.
They prefer temperatures that mimic subtropical conditions, avoiding cold drafts.
High humidity levels are crucial for this plant's growth in indoor settings.
They do not fare well in extreme temperature fluctuations or intense heat.
sunlight: Baby Tears require bright, indirect sunlight for optimal growth indoors.
Direct sunlight may cause the leaves to scorch, affecting plant health.
If placed outdoors, ensure they receive filtered light under shaded areas.
They adapt well to fluorescent lighting, making them ideal for offices.
watering: Keep the soil consistently moist but not waterlogged to prevent root rot.
They benefit from regular watering, particularly during the growing season.
When the top layer of soil feels dry, it's time to water Baby Tears again.
Avoid letting the plant sit in dry soil, as it may cause wilting and stress.
soil: A well-draining potting mix combined with organic matter suits them best.
Baby Tears can thrive in peat-based soil, retaining moisture effectively.
Ensure the soil provides good aeration to support healthy root development.
Consider using a soil mix meant for African violets or similar houseplants.
